review_title: A small university with a personal approach
job_title: Certified Occupational Therapy Assistant in Ingleton, England
pros: Small campus, easy to get to know other students and tutors.
cons: University staff can be difficult to contact, and appointments hard to get

review_title: Very good place to work for
pros:
Good pay 
Good holidays
Good sick
Good line manager 
Good workplace

review_title: Staff very nice but everyone under too much pressure
pros:
Very friendly and interesting staff.
Nice atmosphere with the students.
Modern buildings and facilities.
cons:
Management very under pressure and the impact of redundancies mean that everyone seems to be doing one and a half people's jobs without enough time to do the work well.
As management was looking over their shoulder at the next wave of redundancies there seemed to be a "blame culture".

pros: I enjoy working for UoC - very friendly Uni & supportive staff & Uni supportive of progressing your career . Great location in the Lake District. Uni is very much part of the community and a wide range of disciplines.
cons: Uni hasnt got REF status yet but working towards it.
